line.en: 'Haaa... haaa... haaa...!'
I push down on the heavy pedals and the gears\ncreak.
I worry that the chain, which is stretched to its\nlimit, will snap and fly off at some point.
However, there's no time to think about that\nduring the hill climb.
'Haaa... haaaa... Dammit, I can't do this\nanymore. This sport is just way too severe!'
I'm not proud of this but I decided not to put\nmyself through any pointless hardship.
I don't enjoy putting in a lot of effort.
Just ahead of me is something fun, so that's why\nI can do my best.
At that time, I was getting closer and closer to\nit.
'Haaa... haaa... haaa... Finally... the top of\nthe slope!'
As I climbed to the top of the slope, the view\nall of a sudden opened up.
Below me is the town, spreading far into the\ndistance, and the steep downhill road.
Finally, the time has come for my reward.
I lower my posture, kick down on the pedal and\naccelerate in the blink of an eye!
In spite of the headwind that would have been so\nproblematic on flat ground, I cut through it like\na bullet.
On a downhill slope, speeds can reach close to 80\nkilometers per hour.
If that were a car driving through the city, it\nwould breeze past as it overtook other cars.
If I come off my bike now, I'll be seriously\ninjured.
No joke, I could even die.
After all, when we race, we are almost completely\nexposed.
The road is winding, and still not flat.
At high speeds, when I entrust my body to the\ninertia, the wheels bounce on the uneven road\nsurface.
Strangely, I don't feel any fear.
I only feel overwhelming exhilaration.
Nevertheless, I mustn't lose concentration.
It's not like I hadn't predicted the that there\nmight be unforeseen circumstances.
Even so...
When I opened my eyes, I thought that I was on\nthat hospital bed.
Sure, there's an unfamiliar ceiling. But, I soon\nfigured out that it wasn't a hospital.
'...It's my room, huh?'
I still don't really feel like this is 'my room'\nthough.
I lie on my side on the bed, and vacantly try to\nrecall what happened in my dream.
I forgot most of what occurred from the shock of\nwaking up. But, I still had the general idea of\nwhat kind of dream it was.
I pull the alarm clock towards myself.
'...It's noon already.'
Even though it's Sunday, I've slept too long.
On Sunday, I don't need to prepare breakfast.
As for the jobs like fixing leaks, and other jobs\nthat can be done quickly, I did most of them\nyesterday.
A Sunday, with nothing to do.
I get out of bed and look down at my knee.
There is the scar, fresh from surgery.
'...It was the first time I'd seen it in a while,\nthe dream about that time...'
In the last few days, because of how busy I'd\nbeen and the change of scene, I'd gone without\nhaving any unnecessary thoughts.
Things had only calmed down a little. Yet, I had\nlet my guard down emotionally.
Somehow, I felt strangely sluggish, and didn't\nfeel like getting out of bed.
There was someone knocking on the door.
'Aoi, are you awake? Heeeeey!'
It's Sanae, the third-year boarder.
She's quite a cheerful person but I always feel\nlike she's keeping her distance from me.
Despite that, now...
'Aoi, wake up...! Heeeey! Aoi...!'
'I'm awake.'
First, I answer, then get out of bed and then\nmoved over to the door.
'What is it?'
'Um, well, you have a visitor!'
While thinking it was strange for Sanae to get so\nexcited, I quickly got changed and left the room.
I look outside the entrance to see...
'Hi, Aoi.'
'An-chan!'
When she said I had a visitor, she meant An-chan.
The boarders poked their heads out from behind\nthe wall of the hallway and looked at An-chan\nfrom a distance.
It's just like An-chan to be completely unfazed\nby this weird spectacle.
'Here, eat this with the boarders.'
An-chan said as he passed me a welcoming present.
'What's this? ...Shingen mochi?'
'Someone in the neighborhood gave us this. But,\nwe couldn't finish it all.'
'Oh, is this what I think it is?'
An-chan had always been popular with the girls.
Especially with much older ladies.
He often received presents from them,\nparticularly from the elderly ladies.

It's possible that he could become like the
'Straw Millionaire', and even if he just walked
around the town for a day, there would be no
shortage of things to eat.
I take the souvenir from An-chan, and pass it to\nYuka and the others, who are half-hidden behind\nthe wall of the hallway.
'Here, he said we should eat this together.'
'Hey, who's that guy? What's his connection to\nyou?'
'He's my childhood friend, An-chan.'
'Childhood friend, huh? Really...?'
The others all start saying 'Really...?' too.
'An-chan, come on in. I'll pour you a cup of tea\nor something.'
'But this is a girl's dorm, right?'
'Yes, you're right.'
Because I am staying here, I don't really think\nabout it that often.
'Come on, I'll treat you to lunch.'
'How are you finding it here?'
'Yeah, it's nice. It feels relaxing.'
'Ha ha ha, come on, I know you don't mean that.\nLooking at this view, you don't feel like you're\nback in your hometown, do you?'
'...Yeah, I guess not.'
The reconstruction work has been completed in\nthis area and it feels like a new town.
There are numerous, brand-new buildings, and the\nroads are neatly paved. There's not a trace of\nthe Kazegaura that I once knew.
'But I remember this street. I mean, I used to\ncome down here almost every day.'
If you go this way, it leads to Kazami Shopping\nStreet.
It's the place where me, Ageha and the others\nwere born and raised, and had a small shopping\nstreet.
My family had a small real estate agency set up\non one side of the street.
Ageha's family had a sporting goods store, and\nMasatsugu's had a ramen restaurant.
Then there's An-chan's place, which is a town\nfactory near the shopping street.
My childhood friends and I were all kids of the\nKazami Shopping Street, so we all played\ntogether.
However, the shopping street disappeared due to\nthe reconstruction.
'Have you been to Windy yet?'
'I've been to the underground shopping arcade a\nfew times. I went to buy groceries.'
That was where I went yesterday with Ageha and\nKotori.
'So, you haven't seen the above ground part yet?'
'That's right.'
I was busy, so I hadn't been there.
'Since we're heading in that direction for food,\nwe should take a look along the way.'
'Whoa...'
'It's pretty amazing, huh?'
'Yeah...'
Windy Kazegaura... It's a large shopping mall\nbuilt on the site of the small Kazami Shopping\nStreet, where we grew up.

I've been to the underground level before. But,
I've always entered using the back entrance,
which is near the dormitory. So, I didn't know
know what it was like above.
Even though I imagined a big building...
'I can't believe that Kazami Shopping Street used\nto be here.'
'It's one of the biggest retail facilities in the\ncountry. Along with Windmill Hill, it's one of\nthe new famous spots in Kazegaura!'
I didn't feel at all like I had come back to my\nhometown.
On the contrary, I felt like I was lost in some\nunknown country.
'What happened to everyone from the shopping\nstreet?'
'The ones who wanted to, set up their shops in\nhere.'
'Some moved elsewhere, but everyone's doing OK.'
'Ageha said that she had moved.'
'If you wanna know about Ageha's house...'
'Oh, An-chan!'
'Ah, there you are!'
Ageha appeared with uncanny timing.
'Hey, what are you two doing, having all the fun\nto yourselves?' You should've called me!'
'But you were helping out at your family's shop,\nweren't you?'
'I just finished.'
replied Ageha, who was standing in front of...\nHimegi Sports.
That's what it said on the sign.
'... Oh yeah, you told me that you moved. But\nyour shop, it's in Windy now, right?'
Himegi Sports -- The sporting goods store managed\nby Ageha's father.
As far as I remember, it was a small-town,\nsporting goods store. But now, it was kind of a\ntrendy, sports store aimed at younger people.

They must be thinking of the kind of customers
they'd get in the shopping mall. But, I'm
slightly confused, since it's so different than
to how it was when I was a kid
'Heh heh! It's really great now, huh?'
'...I didn't know that your dad had an eye for\nwhat young people like.'
I answered while slightly dazed.
'Oh, that's right. Hey, Hotaru!'
As Ageha called, from inside the store, a petite\ngirl, smaller than Ageha came outside.
'What is it, Ageha?'
'An-chan and Aoi are here!'
'Huh?'
Hotaru opened her eyes wide for a moment and then\nlooked up at me.
Her face seemed to say 'Is this big guy standing\nhere really Aoi?
In that case, I should prove it myself.
'Long time no see, Hotari...!!'
I rub Hotaru's head in the same way that An-chan\ndid to me.
'Aaaah...! Stop it...Aoi...!'
Hotaru wriggles her head around, at her wit's\nend, as I rub it.
She is Ageha's younger sister.
She's only one year younger, so we used to play\ntogether a lot as kids.
Her personality is the complete opposite of her\nsister; shy and quiet.
'Ha ha ha, you've gotten bigger too!'
Rub rub.
'Waaah! Aoi, my eyes are going round and round!'
'Hey, don't be mean to my sister!'
'I'm not being mean. Am I, Hotaru?'
'Oooow... Don't pinch my cheeks!'
I let go, and for a little while, Hotaru\ncontinued moving her head round and round, even\nthough I wasn't doing anything.
'Whoooah...'
'Geez, that's the first time you've seen her in\nfive years, it's all a bit too sudden. Hotaru,\nare you OK?'
'Yeah, I'm fine... My eyes were going round a\nlittle, that's all.'
'It's really you, Aoi.'
'I'm back, Hotaru. Do you want me to rub your\nhead again?'
I start to move my hands towards her, like I'm\ngoing to do it again...
'Eek!'
Hotaru jumped back and hid behind Ageha.
'Don't be mean.'
BAM!
I've been punched in the ribs.
'Ack! ...I...I just wanted to play with Hotaru a\nlittle, that's all...'
For some reason, Ageha is very protective of\nHotaru.
'I thought I'd come and see you sometime,\nHotaru.'
'Oh, yeah. We go to the same school, so I\nshould've brought her to see you.'
'Hotaru goes there too?'
That's a surprise.
I had the idea in my head that Hotaru would\ndefinitely go to a regular school.
'Everyone was really influenced by An-chan.'
'I told you to give it up though.'
An-chan graduated from Keifuu Academy.
Because it was the school that An-chan went to,\nAgeha and the others all took the entrance exams\nlike it was a matter of course.
I was the same. I knew it was a special school\nwhen I chose to transfer to it.
'Anyway, what are you two doing? ...Could it be\nthat you're on a date?'
'Bingo.'
'Huh?'
'I knew it!'
'Hey, An-chan!'
'Ha ha ha, I guess it's kind of true, isn't it? I\nthought I'd buy Aoi lunch. Do you two wanna come\nwith us?'
'Yes!'
'In that case, we have to invite him too,\notherwise he'll be sulking about it.'
'No, it's no good. If you mean Ma-bou, he's busy\ntoday.'
'What? He's got plans, has he?'
'He's going on a proper date. Yesterday, he was\nboasting about it.'
'But she's cute, isn't she? Ma-kun's girlfriend?'
'If that's how it is, we can't get in his way.\nWe'll go without him.'
'Yay! Eating with An-chan!'
'Hee hee hee, we haven't had a meal together in a\nlong time...'
'Where shall we go? Anywhere is OK with me.'
An-chan asked me.
'You're asking me where we should eat... I still\ndon't know my way around here.'
There are shops everywhere, But, they're still so\nnew to me.
'It's already decided, isn't it? When we get\ntogether, there's only one place for us to go.'
said Ageha as Hotaru nodded.
I also remember, a little slower than the others.
'Taiyouken!'
'Unnnnhhh... Ma-bou's dad doesn't hold back, does\nhe...?'
I felt like my ramen was going to come back up,\nand I just barely kept it down my rubbing my hand\nalong my belly.
'It's because you got carried away and asked for\nthe 'Special Big Bowl'. I made the right choice\nby choosing the 'Big Bowl'!'
'That's still quite a lot, Ageha.'
'That was more than usual. He gave Aoi some extra\nas a special service.'
An-chan, who also had a 'Special Big Bowl', was\ncompletely unfazed.
'Ma-bou's dad was pleased to see you again, Aoi.'
'He even gave us a discount too!'
'But I can't believe that Taiyouken is still\naround.'
Taiyouken is a Chinese restaurant on one side of\nKazami Shopping Street.
It's also Masatsugu's house.
They used to serve regular set menus, but since\nmoving, they've changed direction.
It's become like one of the 'New Wave' ramen\nrestaurants in the city.
'Business is booming. Recently it was in a\nmagazine, and the number of young customers is\nincreasing, so Ma-bou's dad is very happy.'
'His photo was in there too. It was really cool.'
'He had a towel wrapped round his head, his arms\ncrossed, a confident look on his face and a cool\npose.'
Masatsugu is like his father.
In other words, like his father, he gets carried\naway easily and tends to show off.
Whether it'd be a sports event, or a karaoke\ncompetition in town, regardless of winning,\nMa-bou's the center of attention.
'Apart from seeing Ma-bou's dad, the trip wasn't\nnostalgic at all. The taste was completely\ndifferent.'
Before it was plain, soy sauce ramen. But now, it\nhad become pork bone and fish 'Double Soup'.
'Just like this place, everybody changes.'
'That's right. Five years have passed, after\nall.'
'...Yeah, you're right.'
Well, when you say five years, I guess it really\nis a long time.
But some things haven't changed.
Masatsugu's dad was the same as always, the same\ngoes for Ageha and Hotaru, and also An-chan.
The things that I most wanted to stay the same\nare still here.
'Hold on, I'm gonna go get a drink.'
An-chan made us wait at a bench by the side of\nthe road, while he went to buy some juice.
Hotaru went after him.
Ageha and I sat down on the bench.
'Hey, Aoi.'
'What's up?'
'Have you decided which club you want to join?'
I reply vaguely.
'There is one that I thought would be OK.'
'Which one?'
'It's still just a candidate.'
'Come on, just tell me will you?'
'I don't even know if it's a proper club or not.'
'What is it?'
'You're in the Robotics Club, right?'
'Yes. It's the most popular in our school.'
'You enter contests, don't you? Do they fight?'
When I think of robots, I imagine them firing\nmissiles and flying through the air.
'Well, yeah, I guess. ...Maybe what you're\nthinking of is a little different.'
'They do obstacle courses, carry and stack things\nand so on...'
'What the hell?'
'We battle in terms of robot technology. Every\nyear, a theme is chosen, and we make them in\naccordance with that theme.'
'Are you interested?'
'Dunno. You say that you build robots, but I\ndon't really understand it.'
'Well, I guess it's hard to understand.'
'In the last few years, we've been eliminated in\nthe first round every time, and people are never\nreally surprised by that.'
'If you joined and straightened everyone out, I'd\nbe really grateful.'
'Why don't you do it yourself?'
'No, it's not really in my nature.'
If I had to say, Ageha likes to do things at her\nown pace.
'It seems that they were more enthusiastic in the\npast. They were once the runner-up in the\nnationals.'
'Wow, that's amazing.'
'That time, the one who made the robot was...\nsay, you saw her the other day, do you remember?\nThe Super Repeat Student, Amane Mochizuki.'
'Yeah, I remember.'
'Hmm... Is that because she's pretty?'
'No, that's not why...'
Well, that could be one reason.
Ageha makes a face that says that she doesn't\nunderstand as she continues her story.
'When Amane was a first-year, she managed to come\nrunner-up in a competition using a robot that\nshe'd made almost entirely by herself.'
'She lost during the final round because of an\nunforced error: she pushed the wrong button.'
There are no 'what ifs' in a match, but the\nnational championship slipped through her\nfingers.
'She was in her first-year?'
'Yeah, she's on another level, that girl.'
'...What's up, An-chan?'
Before we knew it, An-chan and Hotaru were back,\nwatching from a distance.
'Which will it be, lemonade or orange juice?'
'Lemonade!'
'I'll have the orange juice.'
I take the can of juice and crack it open.
'Thanks!'
As we enjoyed drinking the juice, An-chan watched\nus quietly.
'What is it?'
'Well... It's like we've gone back to the past.'
'The two of you are together again.'
Ageha and I look at each while drinking our\njuice.
Then, embarrassed, we both laughed.
'There's one person missing though. It's typical\nof Ma-bou to not be here at a time like this.'
'He's always been like that.'
'Even when we all got caught playing tricks, he'd\nalways run away by himself.'
'B...but, later on, he would always cry while\napologizing.'
'That guy really is a handful, isn't he?'
Ageha sighed as she said that, and Hotaru and I\nlaugh.
'Even Ma-bou managed to get a girlfriend. You\nguys have to give it a shot too, you know.'
In response to An-chan's teasing, the rest of us\nblush.
'I'm fine! I don't know about Aoi, though.'
'Really...?'
'I've just come back here, haven't I?'
'But you're the dorm mother of a girls dormitory,\nfull of cute girls, and you're getting along well\nwith them already!'
'H-Hey, don't say it like that!'
'Aaah, that girl, huh? She sure was cute.'
'Not you too, An-chan!'
Hotaru looks at me with suspicion.
'Hotaru, it's not like that! I'm just working as\na dorm mother...'
'...But Aoi, you're cool, you'll get a girlfriend\nsoon.'
'I said it's not like that!' Aw, geez, I'm\nthirsty!'
I drink down the rest of the juice in one gulp.
Ageha grinned as she looked at me, while Hotaru\nseemed worried.
'Well then, I'm gonna get going.'
'Whaaaat? You're going back already?'
'Sorry, but I have an urgent job to do this\nevening.'
'Thanks for inviting me out today, An-chan.'
'It's alright. I had fun too.'
'Oh, that's right, I almost forgot.'
An-chan came back and took some small parts from\nhis pocket.
'Here, it's those things that you asked for.'
It was the parts that Amane had requested.
'What are these, and what are they for?'
'They're parts for a glider.'
'A glider...?'
'It's a kind of measuring instrument. One of the\nseniors at school asked me to get it.'
'Ahaaaaaa!!'
Suddenly, Ageha spoke in a loud voice.
'You mean Amane, don't you? If you're talking\nabout gliders, it can only be her!'
'Y...yes, that's right.'
'What's going on? Did you meet her at some\npoint?'
'Kind of.'
It will take a while to explain, so I try to\ndodge the question.
It includes some information that I don't really\nwant to talk about for some reason.
'...Hey, Aoi. Is she that...?'
'Yes, that beautiful girl.'
Once again, I receive a dubious stare from the\nHimegi sisters.
'It's OK, Hotaru. In the time that Aoi has been\naway from this town, he's become quite the\npervert!'
'Oh... really?'
'That's right, it's such a shame.'
'H...hey! Don't fill her head with such\nnonsense!'
'Ha ha ha, watching you guys really puts my mind\nat ease.'
'Don't just stand there laughing, back me up,\nAn-chan!'
'What? There's nothing wrong with it. Being\ninterested in something, falling for someone...'
An-chan gave me a squeeze as he put his arm\naround my shoulder.
'Finding something new is a good thing, Aoi.'
Speaking into my ear, so that only I could hear,\nAn-chan let go of me.
'See ya. Don't make too much noise in a public\nplace!'
Raising one hand and waving it gently, An-chan\nwent home.
After An-chan went back, we went to Himegi Sports\nto say hello to Ageha's father.
Then, I stayed for a little while, enjoyed some\ntea and cakes, and it soon became evening.
As I walked along the street to the dormitory, I\nstill felt like I didn't want to go back just\nyet.
'I might go for a little stroll.'
'...It's changed a lot round here too.'
Before, there was only an embankment here.
We used to play here a lot, catching koi and\ncrucian carp. But now, it had a promenade, and\nhad been made into a walking course.
Well, this was just right for taking a stroll.
I walk slowly while gazing quietly at the lake,\ndyed by the setting sun.
While my hometown had changed a lot in five\nyears, the most important things had not.
...Finding something new is a good thing, Aoi.
'Finding something...'
As I speak quietly to myself, I look at the view\non the other bank.
The windmills standing on the gentle slope face\nthe wind, and slowly turn.
'Even so... the chef's ramen was really tasty.\nNext time, I'll try the dipping noodles.'
'Dipping noodles...'
A little further away, someone was there.
It was a petite girl.
She ran her hand along the fence, and like me,\nwas gazing at Windmill Hill on the opposite bank.
'(...Someone was there?)'
I didn't think anyone was there, so I was talking\nto myself, but it seems that she heard me.
'...Huh? You're that...'
Her mood was a little different, so I didn't\nrealize straight away. But there's no doubt at it\n-- it's the girl from the supermarket.
The girl who bought a lot of 2980 yen per 100\ngrams meat to make curry.
'Was the curry nice?'
'...How do you know about that?'
'Don't you remember? Yesterday, in the\nsupermarket...'
'Oh... That might not have been me.'
'Huh?'
What on earth is she talking about?
'That was my older sister. She was probably\nwalking around cluelessly, and a guy tried to\nchat her up again.'
Older sister?
'It was sukiyaki and sushi.'
'Huh?'
'Yesterday's dinner.'
'Oh, I see.'
She's talking about what was bought at the\nsupermarket.
I guess that's what happened. There's no way you\ncould make curry with something like that.
It seems that at the last minute, she started to\nmake sense.
'Well then, I'd best be off now.'
'Hmm... s...sure.'
It totally felt like, for her, talking to me was\ntoo much hassle, so she dismissively got up and\nleft.
It was a completely different feeling to when I\nmet that girl in the supermarket.

While thinking how strange it was that there
would be such a complete change in a girl whose
name I didn't even know, I returned to the road
home.
It wasn't far from the lake to the dormitory.
I didn't have any time to think about much before\nI got back.
'Something new...'
The parts that I had been given by An-chan were\nin my pocket.
As I held them in my hand, I looked up at the\nclouds slowly floating across the sunset sky.
'These things are going to fly, aren't they?'
I meant the glider parts.
They would become part of that white aircraft,\nand would fly across the sky on those great, big\nwings.
To the other side of the clouds.
The reason why I decided to look up at the clouds\nimpulsively like that might have been because of\nthat girl I had just met.
Forgetting about my silly fantasy, I go through\nthe gate into the dormitory.
'(Hat, not yet, you mustn't move yet!)'
'Quaaack...'
Kotori was in her wheelchair, with her back bent\nover, slowly creeping forwards.
It was almost as though she was walking on\ntiptoes.
'What are you up to this time?'
I was quite used to her doing strange things.\nBut, I still hadn't acquired the ability to\ninstantly determine what it was she was doing.
She gave me a long stare...
'A cat?'
There it was, laying across the stone steps,\nlicking and grooming itself.
Then, on the other side, Hat was waiting.
'Are you trying a pincer attack?'
It didn't really look like that though.
However, if they did, they might be able to...
'Now, Hat!'
Interrupting my thoughts, Kotori gave the signal!
'Quaaack! Quaaack! Quaaaaaaaack!'
Suddenly, Hat started flapping his wings and\nchasing the cat from behind!
Surprised, the cat jumped up and ran in the\nopposite direction...
where Kotori was waiting to catch it!
'Hyaaa!'
There's no way that will work.
The cat, with brilliant footwork like Zidane's\nMarseilles Turn, evaded Kotori and escaped.
'Aww... It ran away...'
'Quack, quack...'
'...You really were trying a pincer attack.'
'Hmph! What's that? You got something to say?'
Kotori realized I was looking at her and sulked\nquietly.
'What were you going to do once you caught the\ncat?'
'Isn't it obvious? I was going to stroke it!'

'It was as if she was saying 'Of course', but
even if she caught a surprised cat as it was
running away, it would go crazy and, at worst,
scratch and cut her.
'Next time, make a better strategy. For example,\nyou could try luring it towards you with a long\npiece of grass.'
'Hmph! I'll think about it!'
she said, as she earnestly wrote a memo.
It looks like she always has a notebook tucked\naway in her wheelchair.
'More importantly!'
POW!
...she points at me.
This is a sign that she has a bone to pick with\nme.
'You're late! Where have you been loitering\naround?'
'Huh? I went for a walk, that's why I'm late.'
Her tone was like a mother scolding her child. I\nwonder if there's something I was supposed to\nhave done?
'The preparations for dinner! You're the one who\nasked me to help!'
'It's still only five o'clock though.'
'Wh... whatever! You didn't even tell me when we\nwould start!'
'Sorry. If I start at about six, I usually finish\nin time.'
'Hmph. Really? Well, we'll do that from\ntomorrow.'
she said as she wrote another note.
'Do you mean that you were waiting for me?'
She must've gotten bored, which is why she\ndecided to catch the cat.
'Yes I was. However, I was waiting to fulfill my\nduties. Don't get any funny ideas!'
'I don't know what sort of funny ideas you mean,\ncould you give me a few examples?'
I'll try teasing her a little.
'Y...you can figure that out for yourself!'
'Anyway, let's go. I'm starving, you know. Isn't\nthat right, Hat?'
'Quack...'
'See, Hat's says he's hungry too.'
'OK. Well then, it's still a little early, but\nshall we get started?'
'Say, what're we having today?'
'Mapo eggplants and egg soup.'
'Is that tasty?'
'Yeah, it's great. It's my specialty.'
'He says it's tasty.'
'Quack!'
As we go through the dormitory door, I realize\nthat my feelings of uneasiness had vanished at\nsome point.
'She tried to do a pincer attack with a duck, to\ncatch a cat, didn't she...?'

Upon remembering that, I began to chuckle to
myself. I realize that I'm strangely calm when
she's with me. Then things start to feel weird
again.
